pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:0.4.eng: The second training rule on expulsion

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying on the Vulture Peak at Rājagaha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā sandiṭṭhā sambhattā bhikkhū isigilipasse tiṇakuṭiyo karitvā vassaṃ upagacchiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.2.eng: At that time a number of monks who were friends had made grass huts on the slope of Mount Isigili and had entered the rainy-season residence there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.3.pli: Āyasmāpi dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto tiṇakuṭikaṃ karitvā vassaṃ upagacchi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.3.eng: Among them was Venerable Dhaniya the potter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū vassaṃvuṭṭhā temāsaccayena tiṇakuṭiyo bhinditvā tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca paṭisāmetvā janapadacārikaṃ pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.4.eng: When the three months were over and they had completed the rainy-season residence, the monks demolished their grass huts, put away the grass and sticks, and left to wander the country.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.5.pli: Āyasmā pana dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto tattheva vassaṃ vasi, tattha hemantaṃ, tattha gimhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.5.eng: But Venerable Dhaniya spent the winter and the summer right there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmato dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa gāmaṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭhassa tiṇahāriyo kaṭṭhahāriyo tiṇakuṭikaṃ bhinditvā tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca ādāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.6.eng: Then, on one occasion, while Dhaniya was in the village to collect almsfood, some women gathering grass and firewood demolished his grass hut and took away the grass and sticks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.7.pli: Dutiyampi kho āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca saṅkaḍḍhitvā tiṇakuṭikaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.7.eng: A second time Dhaniya collected grass and sticks and made a grass hut,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.8.pli: Dutiyampi kho āyasmato dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa gāmaṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭhassa tiṇahāriyo kaṭṭhahāriyo tiṇakuṭikaṃ bhinditvā tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca ādāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.8.eng: and again the hut was demolished in the same way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.9.pli: Tatiyampi kho āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca saṅkaḍḍhitvā tiṇakuṭikaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.9.eng: The same thing happened a third time.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.10.pli: Tatiyampi kho āyasmato dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa gāmaṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭhassa tiṇahāriyo kaṭṭhahāriyo tiṇakuṭikaṃ bhinditvā tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca ādāya agamaṃsu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.11.pli: Atha kho āyasmato dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.12.pli: “yāvatatiyakaṃ kho me gāmaṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭhassa tiṇahāriyo kaṭṭhahāriyo tiṇakuṭikaṃ bhinditvā tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca ādāya agamaṃsu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.13.pli: Ahaṃ kho pana susikkhito anavayo sake ācariyake kumbhakārakamme pariyodātasippo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.13.eng: But I’m well-trained and experienced in my own craft of pottery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.14.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ sāmaṃ cikkhallaṃ madditvā sabbamattikāmayaṃ kuṭikaṃ kareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.14.eng: Why don’t I knead mud myself and make a hut entirely of clay?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.15.pli: Atha kho āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto sāmaṃ cikkhallaṃ madditvā sabbamattikāmayaṃ kuṭikaṃ karitvā tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca gomayañca saṅkaḍḍhitvā taṃ kuṭikaṃ paci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.15.eng: And he did just that. He then collected grass, sticks, and cow-dung, and he baked his hut.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.16.pli: Sā ahosi kuṭikā abhirūpā dassanīyā pāsādikā lohitikā, seyyathāpi indagopako.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.16.eng: It was a pretty and attractive little hut, red in color like a scarlet rain-mite.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.17.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma kiṅkaṇikasaddo; evamevaṃ tassā kuṭikāya saddo ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.1.17.eng: And when struck, it sounded just like a bell.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasa taṃ kuṭikaṃ abhirūpaṃ dassanīyaṃ pāsādikaṃ lohitikaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha was descending from the Vulture Peak with a number of monks when he saw that hut.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.3.pli: “kiṃ etaṃ, bhikkhave, abhirūpaṃ dassanīyaṃ pāsādikaṃ lohitikaṃ, seyyathāpi indagopako”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.3.eng: “What’s this pretty and attractive thing that’s red in color like a scarlet rain-mite?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.6.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, bhikkhave, tassa moghapurisassa ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.6.eng: “It’s not suitable for that foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.7.pli: Kathañhi nāma so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso sabbamattikāmayaṃ kuṭikaṃ karissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.7.eng: How could he make a hut entirely of clay?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.8.pli: Na hi nāma, bhikkhave, tassa moghapurisassa pāṇesu anuddayā anukampā avihesā bhavissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.8.eng: Doesn’t he have any consideration, compassion, and mercy for living beings?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.9.eng: Go, monks, and demolish this hut,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.10.pli: Mā pacchimā janatā pāṇesu pātabyataṃ āpajji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.10.eng: so that future generations don’t follow his example.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.11.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, sabbamattikāmayā kuṭikā kātabbā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.11.eng: And, monks, you shouldn’t make a hut entirely of clay.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.12.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.13.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti, kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā yena sā kuṭikā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ kuṭikaṃ bhindiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.13.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” they went to demolish it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.14.pli: Atha kho āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto te bhikkhū etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.2.17.eng: “Demolish it then, if the Lord of the Truth has said so.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmato dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.2.pli: “yāvatatiyakaṃ kho me gāmaṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭhassa tiṇahāriyo kaṭṭhahāriyo tiṇakuṭikaṃ bhinditvā tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca ādāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.2.eng: “Three times, while I was in the village to collect almsfood, women gathering grass and firewood demolished my hut and took away the grass and sticks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.3.pli: Yāpi mayā sabbamattikāmayā kuṭikā katā sāpi bhagavatā bhedāpitā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.3.eng: And now my hut made entirely of clay has been demolished at the Buddha’s request.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.4.pli: Atthi ca me dārugahe gaṇako sandiṭṭho.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.4.eng: Now, the caretaker of the woodyard is a friend of mine.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.5.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ dārugahe gaṇakaṃ dārūni yācitvā dārukuṭikaṃ kareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.5.eng: Why don’t I ask him for timber and make a hut out of that?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto yena dārugahe gaṇako tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā dārugahe gaṇakaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.6.eng: Dhaniya then went to the caretaker of the woodyard and told him what had happened,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.7.pli: “yāvatatiyakaṃ kho me, āvuso, gāmaṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭhassa tiṇahāriyo kaṭṭhahāriyo tiṇakuṭikaṃ bhinditvā tiṇañca kaṭṭhañca ādāya agamaṃsu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.8.pli: Yāpi mayā sabbamattikāmayā kuṭikā katā sāpi bhagavatā bhedāpitā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.10.eng: I want to make a wooden hut.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.11.pli: “Natthi, bhante, tādisāni dārūni yānāhaṃ ayyassa dadeyyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.11.eng: “There’s no timber, sir, that I could give you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.12.pli: Atthi, bhante, devagahadārūni nagarapaṭisaṅkhārikāni āpadatthāya nikkhittāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.12.eng: This timber is held by the king. It’s meant for repairs of the town and put aside in case of an emergency.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.13.pli: Sace tāni dārūni rājā dāpeti harāpetha, bhante”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.13.eng: You can only have it if the king gives it away.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.14.eng: “Actually, it’s been given by the king.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.15.eng: The caretaker of the woodyard thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.16.pli: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dhammacārino samacārino brahmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.16.eng: “These Sakyan monastics have integrity. They are celibate and their conduct is good, and they are truthful, moral, and have a good character.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.17.eng: Even the king has faith in them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.18.eng: These venerables wouldn’t say something is given if it wasn’t.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.19.pli: Atha kho dārugahe gaṇako āyasmantaṃ dhaniyaṃ kumbhakāraputtaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.21.pli: Atha kho āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto tāni dārūni khaṇḍākhaṇḍikaṃ chedāpetvā sakaṭehi nibbāhāpetvā dārukuṭikaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.3.21.eng: Dhaniya then had that timber cut into pieces, took it away on carts, and made a wooden hut.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.1.pli: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto rājagahe kammante anusaññāyamāno yena dārugahe gaṇako tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā dārugahe gaṇakaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.1.eng: Soon afterwards the brahmin Vassakāra, the chief minister of Magadha, was inspecting the public works in Rājagaha when he went to the caretaker of the woodyard and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.3.pli: devagahadārūni nagarapaṭisaṅkhārikāni āpadatthāya nikkhittāni kahaṃ tāni dārūnī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.3.eng: Where’s the timber held by the king that’s meant for repairs of the town and put aside in case of an emergency?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.4.pli: “Tāni, sāmi, dārūni devena ayyassa dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa dinnānī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.4.eng: “The king has given it to Venerable Dhaniya.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.5.pli: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto anattamano ahosi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma devo devagahadārūni nagarapaṭisaṅkhārikāni āpadatthāya nikkhittāni dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa dassatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.6.eng: “How could the king give away this timber to Dhaniya the potter?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.7.pli: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto yena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.7.eng: He then went to King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira devena devagahadārūni nagarapaṭisaṅkhārikāni āpadatthāya nikkhittāni dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa dinnānī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.8.eng: “Is it true, sir, that you have given away to Dhaniya the potter the timber that was held for repairs of the town and put aside in case of an emergency?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.11.eng: “Well then, brahmin, summon the caretaker of the woodyard.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.12.pli: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto dārugahe gaṇakaṃ bandhaṃ āṇāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.12.eng: And Vassakāra had the caretaker of the woodyard bound and taken by force.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.4.13.pli: Addasa kho āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto dārugahe gaṇakaṃ bandhaṃ niyyamānaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto yena rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.1.eng: Dhaniya then went to King Bimbisāra’s house and sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.2.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro yenāyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ dhaniyaṃ kumbhakāraputtaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.2.eng: The king approached Dhaniya, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro āyasmantaṃ dhaniyaṃ kumbhakāraputtaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.4.pli: “saccaṃ kira mayā, bhante, devagahadārūni nagarapaṭisaṅkhārikāni āpadatthāya nikkhittāni ayyassa dinnānī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.4.eng: “Is it true, venerable, that I have given to you the timber held for repairs of the town and put aside in case of an emergency?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.6.pli: “Mayaṃ kho, bhante, rājāno nāma bahukiccā bahukaraṇīyā,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.7.eng: we may give and not remember.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.9.pli: “Sarasi tvaṃ, mahārāja, paṭhamābhisitto evarūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.9.eng: “Do you remember, great king, when you were first anointed, speaking these words:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.10.eng: ‘I give the grass, sticks, and water for the monastics and brahmins to enjoy’?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.12.pli: Santi, bhante, samaṇabrāhmaṇā lajjino kukkuccakā sikkhākāmā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.12.eng: There are monastics and brahmins who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.13.eng: They are afraid of wrongdoing even in regard to small matters.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.14.pli: Tesaṃ mayā sandhāya bhāsitaṃ, tañca kho araññe apariggahitaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.14.eng: When I spoke, I was referring to them, and it concerned what’s ownerless in the wilderness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.15.pli: So tvaṃ, bhante, tena lesena dārūni adinnaṃ harituṃ maññasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.15.eng: Yet you imagine that you can take timber not given to you by means of this pretext?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.16.pli: Kathañhi nāma mādiso samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā vijite vasantaṃ haneyya vā bandheyya vā pabbājeyya vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.16.eng: Even so, I cannot beat, imprison, or banish a monastic or brahmin living in my own kingdom.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.17.eng: Go, you’re free because of your status,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.5.18.eng: but don’t do such a thing again.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.1.eng: But people complained and criticized him:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.2.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are shameless and immoral liars.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.3.pli: Ime hi nāma dhammacārino samacārino brāhmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā paṭijānissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.3.eng: They claim to have integrity, to be celibate and of good conduct, to be truthful, moral, and good.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.4.pli: Natthi imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ, natthi imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.4.eng: But they don’t have the good character of a monastic or a brahmin.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.5.pli: Naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ, naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.6.pli: Kuto imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ, kuto imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.7.pli: Apagatā ime sāmaññā, apagatā ime brahmaññā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.8.pli: Rājānampi ime vañcenti, kiṃ panaññe manusse”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.8.eng: They even deceive the king, never mind other people.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.9.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.9.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā santuṭṭhā lajjino kukkuccakā sikkhākāmā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.10.eng: The monks of few desires, who had a sense of conscience, and who were contented, afraid of wrongdoing, and fond of the training, complained and criticized Venerable Dhaniya,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto rañño dārūni adinnaṃ ādiyissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.11.eng: “How could he take the king’s timber without it being given to him?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.12.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dhaniyaṃ kumbhakāraputtaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.12.eng: After rebuking Dhaniya in many ways, they told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ dhaniyaṃ kumbhakāraputtaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.13.eng: The Buddha then had the Sangha of monks gathered and questioned Venerable Dhaniya:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, dhaniya, rañño dārūni adinnaṃ ādiyī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.14.eng: “Is it true, Dhaniya, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.17.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.17.eng: “Foolish man, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.18.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, rañño dārūni adinnaṃ ādiyissasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.19.pli: Netaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.20.pli: atha khvetaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānañceva appasādāya pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.20.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.21.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro purāṇavohāriko mahāmatto bhikkhūsu pabbajito bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.21.eng: Just then a former judge who had gone forth with the monks was sitting near the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.22.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.23.pli: “kittakena kho, bhikkhu, rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro coraṃ gahetvā hanati vā bandhati vā pabbājeti vā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.23.eng: “For stealing how much does King Bimbisāra beat, imprison, or banish a thief?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.24.eng: “For stealing a pāda coin, sir, or the value of a pāda.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.25.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe pañcamāsako pādo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.25.eng: At that time in Rājagaha a pāda coin was worth five māsaka coins.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.26.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ dhaniyaṃ kumbhakāraputtaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.26.eng: After rebuking Venerable Dhaniya in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.27.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.27.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.28.1.eng: ‘If a monk, intending to steal, takes what has not been given to him—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.29.pli: yathārūpe adinnādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā—‘corosi bālosi mūḷhosi thenosī’ti, tathārūpaṃ bhikkhu adinnaṃ ādiyamāno
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.29.eng: the sort of stealing for which kings, having caught a thief, would beat, imprison, or banish him, saying, “You’re a bandit, you’re a fool, you’ve gone astray, you’re a thief”—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.30.eng: he too is expelled and excluded from the community.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.31.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:1.6.31.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū rajakattharaṇaṃ gantvā rajakabhaṇḍikaṃ avaharitvā ārāmaṃ haritvā bhājesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.1.eng: At one time the monks from the group of six went to the dyers, stole their stock of cloth, brought it back to the monastery, and shared it out.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.1.comm: The text literally says “the dyers’ spread”, rajakattharaṇaṁ, but the commentary at Sp 1.90 qualifies that this refers to their spread of “cloth”, vatthāni.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.2.eng: The other monks said to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.4.eng: seeing that you’ve gotten so much robe-cloth.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.4.comm: For the rendering of cīvara as “robe-cloth”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.5.eng: “How is it that we have merit?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.6.pli: idāni mayaṃ rajakattharaṇaṃ gantvā rajakabhaṇḍikaṃ avaharimhā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.6.eng: Just now we went to the dyers and stole their cloth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.7.eng: “But hasn’t the Buddha laid down a training rule?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.8.eng: Why then do you steal the dyers’ cloth?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.9.eng: “It’s true that the Buddha has laid down a training rule,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.10.eng: but it concerns inhabited areas, not the wilderness.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.12.pli: Ananucchavikaṃ, āvuso, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.12.eng: It’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.13.pli: Kathañhi nāma tumhe, āvuso, rajakabhaṇḍikaṃ avaharissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.13.eng: How could you steal the dyers’ cloth?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.14.pli: Netaṃ, āvuso, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.15.pli: atha khvetaṃ, āvuso, appasannānañceva appasādāya pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.15.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.16.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.16.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.17.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā chabbaggiye bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.17.eng: The Buddha had the Sangha of monks gathered and questioned those monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.18.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, rajakattharaṇaṃ gantvā rajakabhaṇḍikaṃ avaharitthā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.18.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.21.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisā, ananulomikaṃ appaṭirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.21.eng: “It’s not suitable, foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.22.pli: Kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, rajakabhaṇḍikaṃ avaharissatha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.23.pli: Netaṃ, moghapurisā, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.24.pli: atha khvetaṃ, moghapurisā, appasannānañceva appasādāya pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.24.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.25.pli: Atha kho bhagavā chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.25.eng: Then, after rebuking the monks from the group of six in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.26.pli: vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitvā bhikkhūnaṃ tadanucchavikaṃ tadanulomikaṃ dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi … pe
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.26.eng: but he spoke in praise of … being energetic. Having given a teaching on what is right and proper, he addressed the monks …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.27.pli: … evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.27.eng: “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.28.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.28.1.eng: ‘If a monk, intending to steal, takes from an inhabited area or from the wilderness what has not been given to him—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.29.pli: yathārūpe adinnādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā—‘corosi bālosi mūḷhosi thenosī’ti, tathārūpaṃ bhikkhu adinnaṃ ādiyamāno
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.29.eng: the sort of stealing for which kings, having caught a thief, would beat, imprison, or banish him, saying, “You’re a bandit, you’re a fool, you’ve gone astray, you’re a thief”—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:2.30.eng: he too is expelled and excluded from the community.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.6.pli: ekakuṭikopi gāmo, dvikuṭikopi gāmo, tikuṭikopi gāmo, catukuṭikopi gāmo, samanussopi gāmo, amanussopi gāmo, parikkhittopi gāmo, aparikkhittopi gāmo, gonisādiniviṭṭhopi gāmo, yopi sattho atirekacatumāsaniviṭṭho sopi vuccati gāmo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.6.eng: an inhabited area of one hut, an inhabited area of two huts, an inhabited area of three huts, an inhabited area of four huts, an inhabited area with people, an inhabited area without people, an enclosed inhabited area, an unenclosed inhabited area, a disorganized inhabited area, and even a caravan settled for more than four months is called “an inhabited area”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.6.comm: “Inhabited area” renders gāma. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.7.eng: The access to an inhabited area:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.8.pli: parikkhittassa gāmassa indakhīle ṭhitassa majjhimassa purisassa leḍḍupāto,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.8.eng: of an enclosed inhabited area: a stone’s throw of a man of average height standing at the threshold of the gateway to the inhabited area;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.9.pli: aparikkhittassa gāmassa gharūpacāre ṭhitassa majjhimassa purisassa leḍḍupāto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.9.eng: of an unenclosed inhabited area: a stone’s throw of a man of average height standing at the access to a house.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.11.pli: ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañca avasesaṃ araññaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.11.eng: apart from inhabited areas and the access to inhabited areas, the remainder is called “the wilderness”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.11.comm: “Access” renders upacāra. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.13.pli: yaṃ adinnaṃ anissaṭṭhaṃ apariccattaṃ rakkhitaṃ gopitaṃ mamāyitaṃ parapariggahitaṃ. Etaṃ adinnaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.13.eng: what has not been given, what has not been let go of, what has not been relinquished; what is guarded, what is protected, what is regarded as “mine”, what belongs to someone else. This is called “what has not been given”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.15.eng: the thought of theft, the thought of stealing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.17.pli: ādiyeyya hareyya avahareyya iriyāpathaṃ vikopeyya ṭhānā cāveyya saṅketaṃ vītināmeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.17.eng: takes, carries off, steals, interrupts the movement of, moves from its base, does not stick to an arrangement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.19.pli: pādaṃ vā pādārahaṃ vā atirekapādaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.19.eng: a pāda coin, the value of a pāda, or more than a pāda.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.21.pli: pathabyārājā padesarājā maṇḍalikā antarabhogikā akkhadassā mahāmattā, ye vā pana chejjabhejjaṃ karontā anusāsanti. Ete rājāno nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.21.eng: kings of the earth, kings of a region, rulers of islands, rulers of border areas, judges, government officials, or whoever metes out physical punishment—these are called “kings”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.23.pli: yo pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati. Eso coro nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.23.eng: whoever, intending to steal, takes anything that has not been given, having a value of five māsaka coins or more—he is called “a thief”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.25.pli: hatthena vā pādena vā kasāya vā vettena vā aḍḍhadaṇḍakena vā chejjāya vā haneyyuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.25.eng: would beat with the hand, the foot, a whip, a cane, a cudgel, or by mutilation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.27.pli: rajjubandhanena vā andubandhanena vā saṅkhalikabandhanena vā gharabandhanena vā nagarabandhanena vā gāmabandhanena vā nigamabandhanena vā bandheyyuṃ, purisaguttiṃ vā kareyyuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.27.eng: would imprison by constricting with a rope, by constricting with shackles, by constricting with chains, by constricting to a house, by constricting to a city, by constricting to a village, by constricting to a town, or by guarding.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.29.pli: gāmā vā nigamā vā nagarā vā janapadā vā janapadapadesā vā pabbājeyyuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.29.eng: would banish from a village, from a town, from a city, from a country, or from a district.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.30.eng: You’re a bandit, you’re a fool, you’ve gone astray, you’re a thief:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.31.comm: For the following segments, because I have not tried to replicate the structure of the Pali—in this case the subordinate/demonstrative clause structure and the resulting repetitiveness—the next two terms defined in the Pali have no counterpart in my translation. But no information is lost since both terms have already been defined earlier. The two terms in question are tathārūpaṁ, which is defined in the same way as yathārūpaṁ, “the sort”, and secondly, ādiyamāno, which is defined in the same way as ādiyeyya, “takes”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.33.pli: pādaṃ vā pādārahaṃ vā atirekapādaṃ vā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.35.pli: ādiyamāno haramāno avaharamāno iriyāpathaṃ vikopayamāno ṭhānā cāvayamāno saṅketaṃ vītināmayamāno.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.37.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.39.pli: seyyathāpi nāma paṇḍupalāso bandhanā pavutto abhabbo haritatthāya;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.39.eng: just as a fallen, withered leaf is incapable of becoming green again,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.40.pli: evameva bhikkhu pādaṃ vā pādārahaṃ vā atirekapādaṃ vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo. Tena vuccati— “pārājiko hotī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.40.eng: so too is a monk who, intending to steal, takes an ungiven pāda coin, the value of a pāda, or more than a pāda, not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic. Therefore it is said, “he is expelled.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.42.pli: saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ekuddeso samasikkhatā. Eso saṃvāso nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.42.eng: Community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training—this is called “community”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.43.pli: So tena saddhiṃ natthi. Tena vuccati—“asaṃvāso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:3.43.eng: He does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.1.1.pli: Bhūmaṭṭhaṃ thalaṭṭhaṃ ākāsaṭṭhaṃ vehāsaṭṭhaṃ udakaṭṭhaṃ nāvaṭṭhaṃ yānaṭṭhaṃ bhāraṭṭhaṃ ārāmaṭṭhaṃ vihāraṭṭhaṃ khettaṭṭhaṃ vatthuṭṭhaṃ gāmaṭṭhaṃ araññaṭṭhaṃ udakaṃ dantapoṇaṃ vanappati haraṇakaṃ upanidhi suṅkaghātaṃ pāṇo apadaṃ dvipadaṃ catuppadaṃ bahuppadaṃ ocarako oṇirakkho saṃvidāvahāro saṅketakammaṃ nimittakammanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.1.1.eng: Being underground, being on the ground, being in the air, being above ground, being in water, being in a boat, being in a vehicle, carried as a load, being in a park, being in a monastic dwelling, being in a field, being on a site, being in an inhabited area, being in the wilderness, water, tooth cleaner, forest tree, that which is carried, that which is deposited, customs station, a living being, footless, two-footed, four-footed, many-footed, a spy, a keeper of entrusted property, mutually agreed stealing, acting by arrangement, making a sign.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.2.pli: bhaṇḍaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti nikhātaṃ paṭicchannaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.2.eng: the goods have been placed underground, buried, concealed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.3.pli: Bhūmaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati kudālaṃ vā piṭakaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the underground goods,” and he seeks for a companion, seeks for a spade or a basket, or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.3.comm: “Goes there” renders gacchati. Sp 1.94: Gacchati vā āpatti dukkaṭassāti evaṁ pariyiṭṭhasahāyakudālapiṭako nidhiṭṭhānaṁ gacchati, “Gacchati vā āpatti dukkaṭassa: in this way he goes with the sought friend, with the spade and basket, to the place of the goods.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.4.pli: Tattha jātakaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ vā lataṃ vā chindati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.4.eng: If he breaks a twig or a creeper growing there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.5.pli: Tattha paṃsuṃ khaṇati vā byūhati vā uddharati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.5.eng: If he digs the soil or heaps it up or removes it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.6.eng: If he touches the container, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.6.comm: “Container” renders kumbhi, which actually is a pot or cooking vessel. In the present context, however, the pot is used as a container for goods.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.7.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.8.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.9.pli: Attano bhājanaṃ pavesetvā pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.9.eng: If, intending to steal, he puts his own vessel into the container and touches something worth five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.10.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.11.pli: Attano bhājanagataṃ vā karoti muṭṭhiṃ vā chindati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.11.eng: If he makes it enter his own vessel or takes it with his fist, there is an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.12.pli: Suttāruḷhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ pāmaṅgaṃ vā kaṇṭhasuttakaṃ vā kaṭisuttakaṃ vā sāṭakaṃ vā veṭhanaṃ vā theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.12.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches goods made of string—an ornamental hanging string, a necklace, an ornamental girdle, a wrap garment, or a turban—he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.13.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.14.eng: If he grasps it at the top and pulls it, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.15.eng: If he rubs it while lifting it, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.16.pli: Antamaso kesaggamattampi kumbhimukhā moceti, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.16.eng: If he removes the goods even as much as a hair’s breadth over the rim of the container, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.17.pli: Sappiṃ vā telaṃ vā madhuṃ vā phāṇitaṃ vā pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto ekena payogena pivati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.17.eng: If, intending to steal, he drinks—in a single action—ghee, oil, honey, or syrup having a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.17.comm: “Syrup” renders phāṇita. I. B. Horner instead translates it as “molasses”, which doesn’t quite hit the mark. SED defines phāṇita as “the inspissated juice of the sugarcane or other plants”, in other words, “cane syrup”. According to the commentary at Sp 1.623 it can be either cooked or uncooked, the difference presumably whether it is raw or concentrated. “Syrup” seems closer to the mark than “molasses”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.18.pli: Tattheva bhindati vā chaḍḍeti vā jhāpeti vā aparibhogaṃ vā karoti āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.2.18.eng: If he destroys it, throws it away, burns it, or renders it useless, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.3.2.eng: the goods have been placed on the ground.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.3.3.pli: Thalaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.3.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods on the ground,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.3.4.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.3.5.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.3.6.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.2.eng: the goods are in the air—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.3.pli: Moro vā kapiñjaro vā tittiro vā vaṭṭako vā, sāṭakaṃ vā veṭhanaṃ vā hiraññaṃ vā suvaṇṇaṃ vā chijjamānaṃ patati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.3.eng: a peacock, a partridge, or a quail; or a wrap garment or a turban; or money or gold that falls after being cut loose.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.3.comm: For a discussion of hirañña, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.4.pli: Ākāsaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.4.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods in the air,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.5.eng: If he cuts off their course of movement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.6.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.7.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.4.8.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.5.3.pli: Mañce vā pīṭhe vā cīvaravaṃse vā cīvararajjuyā vā bhittikhile vā nāgadante vā rukkhe vā laggitaṃ hoti, antamaso pattādhārakepi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.5.3.eng: on a bed, on a bench, on a bamboo robe rack, on a clothesline, on a wall peg, in a tree, or even just on a bowl rest.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.5.3.comm: Bhittikhilepi nāgadantakepi, literally, “wall pegs and elephant tusks”. These are different kinds of pegs and I have not tried to differentiate between them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.5.4.pli: Vehāsaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.5.4.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods that are above ground,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.5.5.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.5.6.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.5.7.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.2.eng: the goods have been placed in water.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.3.pli: Udakaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods in the water,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.4.pli: Nimujjati vā ummujjati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.4.eng: If he either dives into the water or floats on the surface, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.5.eng: If he touches the goods, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.6.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.7.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.8.pli: Tattha jātakaṃ uppalaṃ vā padumaṃ vā puṇḍarīkaṃ vā bhisaṃ vā macchaṃ vā kacchapaṃ vā pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.8.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches either a blue, red, or white lotus growing there, or a lotus root, or a fish, or a turtle having a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.9.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.6.10.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.2.eng: that by means of which one crosses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.4.eng: the goods have been placed in a boat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.5.pli: “Nāvaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmī”ti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.5.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods in the boat,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.6.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.7.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.8.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.9.pli: Nāvaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.9.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the boat,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.10.eng: If he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.11.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.12.eng: If he loosens the moorings, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.13.eng: If, after loosening the moorings, he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.14.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.15.pli: Uddhaṃ vā adho vā tiriyaṃ vā antamaso kesaggamattampi saṅkāmeti, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.7.15.eng: If he makes it move upstream or downstream or across the water, even as much as a hair’s breadth, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.2.eng: a wagon, a carriage, a cart, a chariot.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.4.eng: the goods have been placed in a vehicle.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.5.pli: Yānaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.5.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods in the vehicle,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.6.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.7.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.8.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.9.pli: Yānaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.9.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the vehicle,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.10.eng: If he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.11.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.8.12.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.2.eng: a load carried on the head, a load carried on the shoulder, a load carried on the hip, one hanging down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.3.pli: Sīse bhāraṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches the load on the head, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.4.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.5.eng: If he lowers it to the shoulder, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.6.pli: Khandhe bhāraṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.6.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches the load on the shoulder, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.7.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.8.eng: If he lowers it to the hip, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.9.pli: Kaṭiyā bhāraṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.9.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches the load on the hip, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.10.eng: If he causes it to stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.11.eng: If he takes it with the hand, there is an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.12.pli: Hatthe bhāraṃ theyyacitto bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.12.eng: If, intending to steal a load in the hand, he places it on the ground, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.9.13.eng: If, intending to steal, he picks it up from the ground, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.2.comm: Since ārāma is a standard term for a monastery in the Vinaya Piṭaka, monasteries are presumably included under this heading.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.4.pli: bhaṇḍaṃ ārāme catūhi ṭhānehi nikkhittaṃ hoti— bhūmaṭṭhaṃ thalaṭṭhaṃ, ākāsaṭṭhaṃ, vehāsaṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.4.eng: the goods have been placed in a park in four locations: underground, on the ground, in the air, above the ground.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.5.pli: Ārāmaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.5.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods in the park,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.6.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.7.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.8.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.9.pli: Tattha jātakaṃ mūlaṃ vā tacaṃ vā pattaṃ vā pupphaṃ vā phalaṃ vā pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.9.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches something growing there—a root, a piece of bark, a leaf, a flower, or a fruit—having a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.10.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.11.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.12.eng: If he claims the park, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.13.eng: If he evokes doubt in the owner as to his ownership, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.14.pli: Sāmiko na mayhaṃ bhavissatīti dhuraṃ nikkhipati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.14.eng: If the owner thinks, “I won’t get it back,” and he gives up the effort of reclaiming it, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.15.pli: Dhammaṃ caranto sāmikaṃ parājeti, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.15.eng: If he resorts to the law and defeats the owner, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.15.comm: Sp 1.102: Sāmikaṁ parājetīti vinicchayikānaṁ ukkocaṁ datvā kūṭasakkhiṁ otāretvā ārāmasāmikaṁ jinātīti attho, “‘He defeats the owner’: having given a bribe to those deciding (the legal case), having brought a false witness, he defeats the owner of the park. This is the meaning.” In other words, the lawsuit is illegitimate.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.10.16.eng: If he resorts to the law but is defeated, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.2.pli: bhaṇḍaṃ vihāre catūhi ṭhānehi nikkhittaṃ hoti— bhūmaṭṭhaṃ, thalaṭṭhaṃ, ākāsaṭṭhaṃ, vehāsaṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.2.eng: the goods have been placed in a monastic dwelling in four locations: underground, on the ground, in the air, above the ground.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.2.comm: I render vihāra as “monastic dwelling”. In later usage, especially in the commentaries, vihāra comes to refer to entire monasteries, rather than individual dwellings. The commentaries seem to agree that in its early usage the word refers to a dwelling. Sp 1.493: Vihāro nivesanasadiso, “A vihāra is like a house.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.3.pli: Vihāraṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods in the monastic dwelling,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.4.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.5.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.6.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.7.eng: If he claims the monastic dwelling, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.8.eng: If he evokes doubt in the owner as to his ownership, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.9.pli: Sāmiko na mayhaṃ bhavissatīti dhuraṃ nikkhipati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.9.eng: If the owner thinks, “I won’t get it back,” and he gives up the effort of reclaiming it, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.10.pli: Dhammaṃ caranto sāmikaṃ parājeti, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.10.eng: If he resorts to the law and defeats the owner, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.11.11.eng: If he resorts to the law but is defeated, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.2.pli: yattha pubbaṇṇaṃ vā aparaṇṇaṃ vā jāyati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.4.pli: bhaṇḍaṃ khette catūhi ṭhānehi nikkhittaṃ hoti— bhūmaṭṭhaṃ, thalaṭṭhaṃ, ākāsaṭṭhaṃ, vehāsaṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.4.eng: the goods have been placed in a field in four locations: underground, on the ground, in the air, above the ground.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.5.pli: Khettaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti, dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.5.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods in the field,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.6.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.7.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.8.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.9.pli: Tattha jātakaṃ pubbaṇṇaṃ vā aparaṇṇaṃ vā pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.9.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches grain or vegetables that grow there, having a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.10.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.11.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.12.eng: If he claims the field, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.13.eng: If he evokes doubt in the owner as to his ownership, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.14.pli: Sāmiko na mayhaṃ bhavissatīti dhuraṃ nikkhipati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.14.eng: If the owner thinks, “I won’t get it back,” and he gives up the effort of reclaiming it, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.15.pli: Dhammaṃ caranto sāmikaṃ parājeti, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.15.eng: If he resorts to the law and defeats the owner, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.16.eng: If he resorts to the law but is defeated, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.17.pli: Khīlaṃ vā rajjuṃ vā vatiṃ vā mariyādaṃ vā saṅkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.17.eng: If he moves a post, a rope, a fence, or a boundary, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.18.eng: When one action of the moving remains, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.12.19.eng: When the last action of the moving is completed, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.2.eng: the site of a park or a monastery, the site of a monastic dwelling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.2.comm: Again, ārāma means both park and monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.4.pli: bhaṇḍaṃ vatthusmiṃ catūhi ṭhānehi nikkhittaṃ hoti— bhūmaṭṭhaṃ, thalaṭṭhaṃ, ākāsaṭṭhaṃ, vehāsaṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.4.eng: the goods have been placed on a site in four locations: underground, on the ground, in the air, above the ground.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.5.pli: Vatthuṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.5.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods on the site,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.6.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.7.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.8.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.9.eng: If he claims the site, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.10.eng: If he evokes doubt in the owner as to his ownership, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.11.pli: Sāmiko na mayhaṃ bhavissatīti dhuraṃ nikkhipati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.11.eng: If the owner thinks, “I won’t get it back,” and he gives up the effort of reclaiming it, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.12.pli: Dhammaṃ caranto sāmikaṃ parājeti, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.12.eng: If he resorts to the law and defeats the owner, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.13.eng: If he resorts to the law but is defeated, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.14.pli: Khīlaṃ vā rajjuṃ vā vatiṃ vā pākāraṃ vā saṅkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.14.eng: If he moves a post, a rope, a fence, or a boundary, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.15.eng: When one action of the moving remains, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.13.16.eng: When the last action of the moving is completed, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.14.2.pli: bhaṇḍaṃ gāme catūhi ṭhānehi nikkhittaṃ hoti— bhūmaṭṭhaṃ, thalaṭṭhaṃ, ākāsaṭṭhaṃ, vehāsaṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.14.2.eng: the goods have been placed in an inhabited area in four locations: underground, on the ground, in the air, above the ground.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.14.3.pli: Gāmaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.14.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods in the inhabited area,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.14.4.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.14.5.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.14.6.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.2.pli: yaṃ manussānaṃ pariggahitaṃ hoti, taṃ araññaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.2.eng: any wilderness which is owned by people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.4.pli: bhaṇḍaṃ araññe catūhi ṭhānehi nikkhittaṃ hoti— bhūmaṭṭhaṃ, thalaṭṭhaṃ, ākāsaṭṭhaṃ, vehāsaṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.4.eng: the goods have been placed in the wilderness in four locations: underground, on the ground, in the air, above the ground.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.5.pli: Araññaṭṭhaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharissāmīti theyyacitto dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.5.eng: If, intending to steal, he thinks, “I’ll steal the goods in the wilderness,” and he either searches for a companion or goes there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.6.eng: If he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.7.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.8.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.9.pli: Tattha jātakaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ vā lataṃ vā tiṇaṃ vā pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.9.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches something that belongs there—a twig, a creeper, or grass—having a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.10.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.15.11.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.2.pli: bhājanagataṃ vā hoti pokkharaṇiyā vā taḷāke vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.2.eng: in a vessel, in a pond, or in a reservoir.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.4.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.5.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.6.pli: Attano bhājanaṃ pavesetvā pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ udakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.6.eng: If, intending to steal, he puts his own vessel into the container holding the water, and he touches water having a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.6.comm: The Pali text just says “into”, and I have added “the container holding the water” for clarity.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.7.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.8.eng: If he puts it into his own vessel, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.9.eng: If he breaks the embankment, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.10.pli: Mariyādaṃ bhinditvā pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ udakaṃ nikkhāmeti, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.10.eng: If, after breaking the embankment, he allows water to escape that has a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.11.pli: Atirekamāsakaṃ vā ūnapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ udakaṃ nikkhāmeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.11.eng: If he allows water to escape that has a value of more than one māsaka but less than five māsakas, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.12.pli: Māsakaṃ vā ūnamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ udakaṃ nikkhāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.16.12.eng: If he allows water to escape that has a value of one māsaka or less, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.17.2.eng: either ready for use or not.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.17.3.pli: Pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.17.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches what has a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.17.4.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.17.5.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.18.2.pli: yo manussānaṃ pariggahito hoti rukkho paribhogo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.18.2.eng: whatever useful tree is owned by people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.18.3.pli: Theyyacitto chindati, pahāre pahāre āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.18.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he fells it, then for each blow he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.18.4.eng: When one blow remains before the tree is felled, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.18.5.eng: When the last blow is completed, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.2.eng: the goods of another are being carried.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.4.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.5.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.6.pli: Sahabhaṇḍahārakaṃ padasā nessāmīti paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ saṅkāmeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.6.eng: If he thinks, “Together with the carrier I’ll carry off the goods,” and he makes the carrier move one foot, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.7.eng: If he makes him move the second foot, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.8.pli: Patitaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ gahessāmīti pātāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.8.eng: If he thinks, “I’ll take the fallen goods,” and he makes them fall, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.9.pli: Patitaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.9.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches fallen goods having a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.10.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.19.11.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.20.3.pli: Dehi me bhaṇḍanti vuccamāno nāhaṃ gaṇhāmīti bhaṇati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.20.3.eng: If the monk is told, “Give me my goods,” and he says, “I won’t get them for you,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.20.4.eng: If he evokes doubt in the mind of the owner as to whether he will get them back, he commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.20.4.comm: The Pali text just says that he evokes doubt in the mind of the owner, sāmikassa vimatiṁ uppādeti. That the doubt refers to the possibility of getting the goods back is supplied from the commentary. Sp 1.112: “Dassati nu kho me no”ti sāmiko vimatiṁ uppādeti, “He evokes doubt in the mind of the owner in this way, ‘Will he give it or not?’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.20.5.pli: Sāmiko na mayhaṃ dassatīti dhuraṃ nikkhipati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.20.5.eng: If the owner thinks, “He won’t give them to me,” and he gives up the effort of getting them back, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.20.6.pli: Dhammaṃ caranto sāmikaṃ parājeti, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.20.6.eng: If he resorts to the law and defeats the owner, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.20.7.eng: If he resorts to the law but is defeated, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.2.pli: raññā ṭhapitaṃ hoti pabbatakhaṇḍe vā nadītitthe vā gāmadvāre vā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.2.eng: it is established by a king in a mountain-pass, at a ford in a river, or at the gateway of a village

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.3.eng: so that tax can be collected from any person passing through.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.4.pli: Tatra pavisitvā rājaggaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.4.eng: If, intending to steal and having entered the customs station, he touches goods that have a tax value to the king of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.4.comm: Although not explicitly stated in the Canonical text, the commentary confirms that the value meant is the tax value. Sp 1.113: Rājaggaṁ bhaṇḍanti: rājārahaṁ bhaṇḍaṁ; yato rañño pañcamāsakaṁ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṁ vā agghanakaṁ suṅkaṁ dātabbaṁ hoti, taṁ bhaṇḍanti attho, “Goods having a value to the king means: goods having a worth to the king. The meaning is: the goods for which a tax having a value of five māsaka coins or more is to be given to the king.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.5.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.6.pli: Paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ suṅkaghātaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.6.eng: If he goes beyond the customs station with one foot, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.7.eng: If he goes beyond the customs station with the second foot, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.8.pli: Antosuṅkaghāte ṭhito bahisuṅkaghātaṃ pāteti, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.8.eng: If, standing within the customs station, he makes the goods fall outside the customs station, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.21.9.eng: If he avoids the customs station altogether, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.22.2.eng: a human being is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.22.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches the person, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.22.4.eng: If he makes the person stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.22.5.eng: If he moves the person from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.22.6.pli: Padasā nessāmīti paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ saṅkāmeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.22.6.eng: If he thinks, “I’ll take the person away on foot,” and he makes them move the first foot, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.22.7.eng: If he makes them move the second foot, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.23.3.pli: Pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.23.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches what has a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.23.4.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.23.5.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.24.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.24.4.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.24.5.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.24.6.pli: Padasā nessāmīti paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ saṅkāmeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.24.6.eng: If he thinks, “I’ll take it away on foot,” and he makes it move the first foot, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.24.7.eng: If he makes it move the second foot, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.2.pli: hatthī assā oṭṭhā goṇā gadrabhā pasukā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.2.eng: elephants, horses, camels, cattle, donkeys, domesticated animals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.4.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.5.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.6.pli: Padasā nessāmīti paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ saṅkāmeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.6.eng: If he thinks, “I’ll take it away on foot,” and he makes it move the first foot, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.7.eng: If he makes it move the second foot, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.8.eng: If he makes it move the third foot, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.25.9.eng: If he makes it move the fourth foot, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.26.3.pli: Pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.26.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches what has a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.26.4.eng: If he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.26.5.eng: If he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.26.6.pli: Padasā nessāmīti saṅkāmeti, pade pade āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.26.6.eng: If he thinks, “I’ll take it away on foot,” and he makes it move, he commits a serious offense for each leg that moves.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.26.7.eng: When the last leg moves, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.27.3.eng: If he describes them, saying, “Steal such-and-such goods,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.27.4.pli: So taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharati, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.27.4.eng: If he steals those goods, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.28.2.eng: a monk who guards goods that have been brought to him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.28.3.pli: pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ theyyacitto āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.28.3.eng: If, intending to steal, he touches what has a value of five māsaka coins or more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.28.4.eng: If he makes them stir, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.28.5.eng: If he moves them from their base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.29.3.pli: eko bhaṇḍaṃ avaharati, āpatti sabbesaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.29.3.eng: If only one steals the goods, there is an offense entailing expulsion for all of them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.30.2.pli: saṅketaṃ karoti— “purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā rattiṃ vā divā vā
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.30.2.eng: one makes an arrangement for before the meal or for after the meal, for the night or for the day.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.30.3.pli: tena saṅketena taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharā”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.30.3.eng: If he says, “Steal those goods according to this arrangement,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.30.4.pli: Tena saṅketena taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharati, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.30.4.eng: If the other steals those goods according to that arrangement, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.30.5.pli: Taṃ saṅketaṃ pure vā pacchā vā taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharati, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.30.5.eng: If he steals those goods before or after the time of the arrangement, there is no offense for the instigator,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.30.6.eng: but an offense entailing expulsion for the thief.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.31.3.pli: Akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇissāmi bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipissāmi sīsaṃ vā ukkhipissāmi, tena nimittena taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.31.3.eng: If he says, “When I wink, at that sign steal the goods,” or, “When I raise an eyebrow, at that sign steal the goods,” or, “When I nod, at that sign steal the goods,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.31.4.pli: Tena nimittena taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharati, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.31.4.eng: If, at that sign, the other steals the goods, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.31.5.pli: Taṃ nimittaṃ pure vā pacchā vā taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharati, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.31.5.eng: If he steals the goods before or after the sign, there is no offense for the instigator,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:4.31.6.eng: but an offense entailing expulsion for the thief.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.1.eng: If a monk tells a monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.2.eng: “Steal such-and-such goods,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.3.pli: So taṃ maññamāno taṃ avaharati, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.3.eng: If the other monk steals them, thinking they are the ones he was told to steal, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.4.eng: If a monk tells a monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.5.eng: “Steal such-and-such goods,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.6.eng: If the other monk steals other goods, thinking they are the ones he was told to steal,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.7.eng: there is no offense for the instigator,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.8.eng: but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the thief.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.9.eng: If a monk tells a monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.10.eng: “Steal such-and-such goods,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.11.eng: If the other monk steals them, thinking they are other than what he was told to steal,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.12.eng: there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.13.eng: If a monk tells a monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.14.eng: “Steal such-and-such goods,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.15.eng: If the other monk steals other goods, thinking they are other than what he was told to steal,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.16.eng: there is no offense for the instigator,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.1.17.eng: but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the thief.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.1.eng: If a monk tells a monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.2.pli: “itthannāmassa pāvada—‘itthannāmo itthannāmassa pāvadatu—itthannāmo itthannāmaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharatū’”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.2.eng: “Tell so-and-so to tell so-and-so to steal such-and-such goods,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.3.eng: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.4.eng: In telling the next person, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.5.eng: If the potential thief agrees, there is a serious offense for the instigator.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.6.pli: So taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharati, āpatti sabbesaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.6.eng: If he steals those goods, there is an offense entailing expulsion for all of them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.7.eng: If a monk tells a monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.8.pli: “itthannāmassa pāvada—‘itthannāmo itthannāmassa pāvadatu—itthannāmo itthannāmaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharatū’”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.8.eng: “Tell so-and-so to tell so-and-so to steal such-and-such goods,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.9.eng: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.10.eng: If the other monk tells someone else than the one he was told to tell, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.11.eng: If the potential thief agrees, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.12.pli: So taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharati, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.12.eng: If he steals those goods, there is no offense for the instigator,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.13.pli: Āṇāpakassa ca avahārakassa ca āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.2.13.eng: but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the messenger and for the thief.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.3.1.eng: If a monk tells a second monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.3.3.eng: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.3.5.eng: “I’m not able to steal those goods.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.3.6.eng: If the first monk tells him again,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.3.7.eng: “When you’re able, then steal those goods,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.3.8.eng: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.3.9.eng: If the second monk steals the goods,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.3.10.eng: there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.1.eng: If a monk tells a second monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.3.eng: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.4.eng: He then regrets it, but does not say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.6.eng: If the second monk then steals those goods,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.7.eng: there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.8.eng: If a monk tells a second monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.10.eng: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.11.eng: He then regrets it and says,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.13.pli: So “āṇatto ahaṃ tayā”ti, taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ avaharati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.13.eng: If the second monk replies, “I’ve been told by you to do so,” and he then steals those goods,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.14.eng: there is no offense for the instigator,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.15.eng: but an offense entailing expulsion for the thief.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.16.eng: If a monk tells a second monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.18.eng: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.19.eng: He then regrets it and says,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:5.4.22.eng: and desists, there is no offense for either.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.1.pli: Pañcahi ākārehi adinnaṃ ādiyantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.1.eng: For one who steals there is an offense entailing expulsion when five factors are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.2.eng: it is the possession of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.4.pli: garuko ca hoti parikkhāro, pañcamāsako vā atirekapañcamāsako vā,.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.4.eng: it is a valuable possession worth five māsaka coins or more;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.5.eng: he has the intention to steal it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.6.eng: if he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.7.eng: if he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.8.eng: if he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.9.pli: Pañcahi ākārehi adinnaṃ ādiyantassa āpatti thullaccayassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.9.eng: For one who steals there is a serious offense when five factors are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.10.eng: it is the possession of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.12.pli: lahuko ca hoti parikkhāro, atirekamāsako vā ūnapañcamāsako vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.12.eng: it is an ordinary possession worth more than one māsaka coin, but less than five;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.13.eng: he has the intention to steal it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.14.eng: if he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.15.eng: if he makes it stir, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.16.eng: if he moves it from its base, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.17.pli: Pañcahi ākārehi adinnaṃ ādiyantassa āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.17.eng: For one who steals there is an offense of wrong conduct when five factors are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.18.eng: it is the possession of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.20.pli: lahuko ca hoti parikkhāro, māsako vā ūnamāsako vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.20.eng: it is an ordinary possession worth one māsaka coin or less;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.21.eng: he has the intention to steal it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.22.eng: if he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.23.eng: if he makes it stir, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.1.24.eng: if he moves it from its base, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.1.pli: Chahi ākārehi adinnaṃ ādiyantassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.1.eng: For one who steals there is an offense entailing expulsion when six factors are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.2.eng: he does not perceive it as his own;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.3.eng: he does not take it on trust;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.5.pli: garuko ca hoti parikkhāro, pañcamāsako vā atirekapañcamāsako vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.5.eng: it is a valuable possession worth five māsaka coins or more;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.6.eng: he has the intention to steal it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.7.eng: if he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.8.eng: if he makes it stir, he commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.9.eng: if he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.10.pli: Chahi ākārehi adinnaṃ ādiyantassa āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.10.eng: For one who steals there is a serious offense when six factors are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.11.eng: he does not perceive it as his own;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.12.eng: he does not take it on trust;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.14.pli: lahuko ca hoti parikkhāro atirekamāsako vā ūnapañcamāsako vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.14.eng: it is an ordinary possession worth more than one māsaka coin, but less than five;
