pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.15.eng: he has the intention to steal it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.16.eng: if he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.17.eng: if he makes it stir, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.18.eng: if he moves it from its base, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.19.pli: Chahi ākārehi adinnaṃ ādiyantassa āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.19.eng: For one who steals there is an offense of wrong conduct when six factors are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.20.eng: he does not perceive it as his own;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.21.eng: he does not take it on trust;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.23.pli: lahuko ca hoti parikkhāro, māsako vā ūnamāsako vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.23.eng: it is an ordinary possession worth one māsaka coin or less;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.24.eng: he has the intention to steal it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.25.eng: if he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.26.eng: if he makes it stir, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.2.27.eng: if he moves it from its base, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.1.pli: Pañcahi ākārehi adinnaṃ ādiyantassa āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.1.eng: For one who steals there is an offense of wrong conduct when five factors are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.2.eng: it is not the possession of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.3.eng: but he perceives it as the possession of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.4.pli: garuko ca hoti parikkhāro, pañcamāsako vā atirekapañcamāsako vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.4.eng: it is a valuable possession worth five māsaka coins or more;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.5.eng: he has the intention to steal it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.6.eng: if he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.7.eng: if he makes it stir, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.8.eng: if he moves it from its base, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.9.pli: Pañcahi ākārehi adinnaṃ ādiyantassa āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.9.eng: For one who steals there is an offense of wrong conduct when five factors are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.10.eng: it is not the possession of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.11.eng: but he perceives it as the possession of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.12.pli: lahuko ca hoti parikkhāro, atirekamāsako vā ūnapañcamāsako vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.12.eng: it is an ordinary possession worth more than one māsaka coin, but less than five;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.13.eng: he has the intention to steal it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.14.eng: if he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.15.eng: if he makes it stir, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.16.eng: if he moves it from its base, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.17.pli: Pañcahi ākārehi adinnaṃ ādiyantassa āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.17.eng: For one who steals there is an offense of wrong conduct when five factors are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.18.eng: it is not the possession of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.19.eng: but he perceives it as the possession of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.20.pli: lahuko ca hoti parikkhāro, māsako vā ūnamāsako vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.20.eng: it is an ordinary possession worth one māsaka coin or less;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.21.eng: he has the intention to steal it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.22.eng: if he touches it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.23.eng: if he makes it stir, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.3.24.eng: if he moves it from its base, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.2.eng: if he perceives it as his own;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.3.eng: if he takes it on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.3.comm: This refers to a situation where you have an agreement with a close friend that you may take their belongings on trust. The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.5.eng: if it is the possession of a ghost;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.6.eng: if it is the possession of an animal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.7.eng: if he perceives it as discarded;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.10.eng: if he is overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.11.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.12.eng: The first section for recitation on stealing is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.18.eng: Five are told with ways of speaking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.21.eng: With the sauna it is ten.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.22.eng: Five are told with animal kills,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.23.eng: And five on without proper reason;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.24.eng: Boiled rice during a shortage of food, and meat,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.27.eng: Mattress, bamboo, on not coming out;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.28.eng: And taking fresh food on trust,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.29.eng: Another two on perceiving as one’s own.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.31.eng: And seven where they did steal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.32.eng: Seven where they stole from the Sangha,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.37.eng: And he set a vehicle in motion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.38.eng: Two on a piece, two on wood,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.41.eng: Another did not amount to it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.43.eng: Two on kills, two about grass;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.44.eng: Seven where they divided the belongings of the Sangha,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.46.eng: Wood, water, clay, two on grass,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.47.eng: Seven on stealing the Sangha’s bedding;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.48.eng: And one should not take away what has an owner,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:6.4.49.eng: One may borrow what has an owner.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū rajakattharaṇaṃ gantvā rajakabhaṇḍikaṃ avahariṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.1.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six went to the dyers and stole their collection of cloth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.1.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.1.4.pli: Kacci nu kho mayaṃ pārājikaṃ āpattiṃ āpannā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.1.4.eng: Could it be that we’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.1.6.eng: “Monks, you have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu rajakattharaṇaṃ gantvā mahagghaṃ dussaṃ passitvā theyyacittaṃ uppādesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.1.eng: On one occasion a monk went to the dyers, saw a valuable cloth, and had the intention to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.4.pli: kacci nu kho ahaṃ pārājikaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.4.eng: Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.6.eng: “There’s no offense for the arising of a thought.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu rajakattharaṇaṃ gantvā mahagghaṃ dussaṃ passitvā theyyacitto āmasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.7.eng: On one occasion a monk went to the dyers, saw a valuable cloth, and touched it, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.10.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.11.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu rajakattharaṇaṃ gantvā mahagghaṃ dussaṃ passitvā theyyacitto phandāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.11.eng: On one occasion a monk went to the dyers, saw a valuable cloth, and made it stir, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu rajakattharaṇaṃ gantvā mahagghaṃ dussaṃ passitvā theyyacitto ṭhānā cāvesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.15.eng: On one occasion a monk went to the dyers, saw a valuable cloth, and moved it from its base, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.2.17.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu mahagghaṃ uttarattharaṇaṃ passitvā theyyacittaṃ uppādesi …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.3.1.eng: On one occasion an alms-collecting monk saw a valuable bedspread and had the intention to steal it. … “There’s no offense for the arising of a thought.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.3.2.eng: and touched it, intending to steal it. … “There’s no offense entailing expulsion, but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.3.3.eng: and made it stir, intending to steal it. … “There’s no offense entailing expulsion, but there’s a serious offense.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.3.4.eng: and moved it from its base, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.3.6.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu divā bhaṇḍaṃ passitvā nimittaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.1.eng: On one occasion a monk saw some goods during the day. He took note of them with the thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.3.eng: And he stole them, thinking they were the ones he had seen. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.4.eng: But he stole other goods, thinking they were the ones he had seen. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.5.eng: And he stole them, thinking they were other than the ones he had seen. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.6.eng: But he stole other goods, thinking they were other than the ones he had seen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.8.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu divā bhaṇḍaṃ passitvā nimittaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.9.eng: On one occasion a monk saw some goods during the day. He took note of them with the thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.11.pli: So taṃ maññamāno attano bhaṇḍaṃ avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.11.eng: But he stole his own goods, thinking they were the ones he had seen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.4.14.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu aññassa bhaṇḍaṃ haranto sīse bhāraṃ theyyacitto āmasi …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.1.eng: On one occasion a monk who was carrying the goods of another on his head touched the load, intending to steal it. … “There’s no offense entailing expulsion, but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.2.eng: made it stir, intending to steal it. … “There’s no offense entailing expulsion, but there’s a serious offense.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.3.eng: lowered it onto his shoulder, intending to steal it. … “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.4.eng: touched the load on the shoulder, intending to steal it. … “There’s no offense entailing expulsion, but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.5.eng: made it stir, intending to steal it. … “There’s no offense entailing expulsion, but there’s a serious offense.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.6.eng: lowered it onto his hip, intending to steal it. … “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.7.eng: touched the load on the hip, intending to steal it. … “There’s no offense entailing expulsion, but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.8.eng: made it stir, intending to steal it. … “There’s no offense entailing expulsion, but there’s a serious offense.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.9.eng: took hold of it with his hand, intending to steal it. … “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.10.eng: placed the load in his hand on the ground, intending to steal it. … “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.11.eng: picked it up from the ground, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.5.13.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu ajjhokāse cīvaraṃ pattharitvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.1.eng: On one occasion a monk spread out his robe outside and entered his dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.2.eng: A second monk, thinking, “Let me look after it,” put it away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.3.pli: So nikkhamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ pucchi— “āvuso, mayhaṃ cīvaraṃ kena avahaṭan”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.3.eng: The first monk came out of his dwelling and asked the monks, “Who’s taken my robe?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.4.eng: The second monk said, “I’ve taken it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.5.eng: The first monk took hold of him and said, “You’re not a monastic anymore!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.9.eng: “Sir, it was just a way of speaking.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.10.eng: “If it was just a way of speaking, there’s no offense.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.11.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu pīṭhe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.11.eng: On one occasion a monk placed his robe on a bench …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.11.comm: I have added one set of ellipses points at the end of the sentence. They seem to have been omitted by mistake from the Pali.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.12.eng: placed his sitting mat on a bench …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.13.eng: put his almsbowl under a bench and entered his dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.14.eng: A second monk, thinking, “Let me look after it,” put it away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.15.pli: So nikkhamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ pucchi— “āvuso, mayhaṃ patto kena avahaṭo”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.15.eng: The first monk came out and asked the monks, “Who’s taken my bowl?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.16.eng: The second monk said, “I’ve taken it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.17.eng: The first monk took hold of him and said, “You’re not a monastic anymore!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.19.eng: “If it was just a way of speaking, there’s no offense.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.20.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī vatiyā cīvaraṃ pattharitvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.20.eng: On one occasion a nun spread out her robe on a fence and entered her dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.21.eng: A second nun, thinking, “Let me look after it,” put it away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.22.eng: The first nun came out and asked the nuns,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.24.eng: The second nun said, “I’ve taken it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.25.eng: The first nun took hold of her and said, “You’re not a monastic anymore!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.27.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.28.eng: who in turn told the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.29.eng: who in turn told the Buddha. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.6.30.eng: “If it was just a way of speaking, there’s no offense.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu vātamaṇḍalikāya ukkhittaṃ sāṭakaṃ passitvā sāmikānaṃ dassāmīti, aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.7.1.eng: On one occasion a monk saw a wrap garment blown up by a whirlwind. He took hold of it, thinking, “I’ll give it to the owners.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.7.2.eng: But the owners accused him, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.7.6.eng: “I didn’t intend to steal it, sir.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.7.7.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t intend to steal.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.7.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu vātamaṇḍalikāya ukkhittaṃ veṭhanaṃ passitvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.7.8.eng: On one occasion a monk took hold of a turban that had been blown up by a whirlwind,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.7.9.eng: intending to steal it before the owners found out.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.7.13.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu susānaṃ gantvā abhinne sarīre paṃsukūlaṃ aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.1.eng: On one occasion a monk went to a charnel ground and took the rags from a fresh corpse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.2.eng: The ghost was still dwelling in that body,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.3.pli: Atha kho so peto taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.3.eng: and it said to the monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.5.eng: The monk took no notice and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.6.pli: Atha kho taṃ sarīraṃ uṭṭhahitvā tassa bhikkhuno piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.6.eng: Then the corpse got up and followed behind that monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.7.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu vihāraṃ pavisitvā dvāraṃ thakesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.7.eng: The monk entered his dwelling and closed the door,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.8.pli: Atha kho taṃ sarīraṃ tattheva paripati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.8.eng: and the corpse collapsed right there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.11.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, abhinne sarīre paṃsukūlaṃ gahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.11.eng: But a monk shouldn’t take rags from a fresh corpse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.8.12.eng: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.9.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa cīvare bhājīyamāne theyyacitto kusaṃ saṅkāmetvā cīvaraṃ aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.9.1.eng: On one occasion robe-cloth belonging to the Sangha was being distributed. A monk disregarded the draw and took the robe-cloth, intending to steal it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.9.1.comm: “Disregarded the draw” renders kusaṁ saṅkāmetvā. Kusa-grass was used to draw lots when distributing robe-cloth, see Kd 8:9.4.4.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.9.3.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.10.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ānando jantāghare aññatarassa bhikkhuno antaravāsakaṃ attano maññamāno nivāsesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.10.1.eng: On one occasion when Venerable Ānanda was in a sauna, he thought the sarong of another monk was his own and put it on.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.10.2.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.10.3.pli: “kissa me tvaṃ, āvuso ānanda, antaravāsakaṃ nivāsesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.10.3.eng: “Ānanda, why did you put on my sarong?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.10.6.eng: “There’s no offense for one who perceives it as his own.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.11.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohantā sīhavighāsaṃ passitvā pacāpetvā paribhuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.11.1.eng: On one occasion a number of monks were descending from the Vulture Peak when they saw the remains of a lion’s kill. They had it cooked and ate it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.11.3.eng: “There’s no offense when it’s the remains of a lion’s kill.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.11.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohantā byagghavighāsaṃ passitvā …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.11.4.eng: On one occasion a number of monks were descending from the Vulture Peak when they saw the remains of a tiger’s kill …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.11.5.eng: saw the remains of a panther’s kill …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.11.6.eng: saw the remains of a hyena’s kill …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.11.7.eng: saw the remains of a wolf’s kill. They had it cooked and ate it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.11.9.eng: “There’s no offense when it’s the possession of an animal.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa odane bhājīyamāne—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.1.eng: On one occasion, when rice belonging to the Sangha was being distributed,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.2.eng: a monk said without grounds, “Please give me a portion for one more,” and he took it away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.5.eng: but there’s an offense entailing confession for lying in full awareness.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa khādanīye bhājīyamāne …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.6.eng: On one occasion, when fresh food belonging to the Sangha was being distributed …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.6.comm: “Fresh food” renders khādanīya. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.7.eng: when cookies belonging to the Sangha were being distributed …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.8.eng: when sugarcane belonging to the Sangha was being distributed …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.9.eng: when gaub fruits belonging to the Sangha were being distributed,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.10.eng: a monk said without grounds, “Please give me a portion for one more,” and he took it away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.12.13.eng: but there’s an offense entailing confession for lying in full awareness.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu dubbhikkhe odanīyagharaṃ pavisitvā pattapūraṃ odanaṃ theyyacitto avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.1.eng: On one occasion during a shortage of food, a monk entered a rice kitchen and took a bowlful of boiled rice, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.3.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu dubbhikkhe sūnagharaṃ pavisitvā pattapūraṃ maṃsaṃ theyyacitto avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.4.eng: On one occasion during a shortage of food, a monk entered a slaughterhouse and took a bowlful of meat, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.6.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu dubbhikkhe pūvagharaṃ pavisitvā pattapūraṃ pūvaṃ theyyacitto avahari …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.7.eng: On one occasion during a shortage of food, a monk entered a bakery and took a bowlful of cookies, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.8.eng: took a bowlful of pastries, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.9.eng: took a bowlful of cakes, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.13.11.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu divā parikkhāraṃ passitvā nimittaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.1.eng: On one occasion a certain monk saw a requisite during the day. He took note of it with the thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.3.eng: He then stole it, thinking it was what he had seen …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.4.eng: He then stole something else, thinking it was what he had seen …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.5.eng: He then stole it, thinking it was something other than what he had seen …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.6.eng: He then stole something else, thinking it was something other than what he had seen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.8.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu divā parikkhāraṃ passitvā nimittaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.9.eng: On one occasion a certain monk saw a requisite during the day. He took note of it with the thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.11.pli: So taṃ maññamāno attano parikkhāraṃ avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.11.eng: But he stole his own requisite, thinking it was what he had seen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.14.14.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.15.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu pīṭhe thavikaṃ passitvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.15.1.eng: On one occasion a monk saw a bag on a bench.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.15.2.pli: “ito gaṇhanto pārājiko bhavissāmī”ti saha pīṭhakena saṅkāmetvā aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.15.2.eng: He thought, “If I take it from there I shall be expelled,” and so he took it by moving the bench.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.15.4.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.16.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa bhisiṃ theyyacitto avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.16.1.eng: On one occasion a monk took a mattress from the Sangha, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.16.3.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.17.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu cīvaravaṃse cīvaraṃ theyyacitto avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.17.1.eng: On one occasion a monk took a robe from a bamboo robe rack, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.17.3.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.18.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu vihāre cīvaraṃ avaharitvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.18.1.eng: On one occasion a monk stole a robe in a dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.18.2.pli: “ito nikkhamanto pārājiko bhavissāmī”ti vihārā na nikkhami …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.18.2.eng: He thought, “If I come out from here, I shall be expelled,” and he remained in that dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.18.4.pli: “Nikkhami vā so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso na vā nikkhami, āpatti pārājikassā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.18.4.eng: “Whether that fool comes out or not, he has committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.19.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sahāyakā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.19.1.eng: At one time there were two monks who were friends.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.19.2.eng: One of them went into the village for almsfood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.19.3.pli: Dutiyo bhikkhu saṅghassa khādanīye bhājīyamāne sahāyakassa bhāgaṃ gahetvā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.19.3.eng: When fresh food belonging to the Sangha was being distributed, the second monk took his friend’s portion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.19.4.eng: Taking it on trust, he ate it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.19.5.eng: When he found out about this, the first monk accused him, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.19.10.eng: “There’s no offense for one who takes on trust.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū cīvarakammaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.1.eng: On one occasion a number of monks were making robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.2.pli: Saṅghassa khādanīye bhājīyamāne sabbesaṃ paṭivisā āharitvā upanikkhittā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.2.eng: When fresh food belonging to the Sangha was being distributed, they took their shares and put them aside.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.3.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu aññatarassa bhikkhuno paṭivisaṃ attano maññamāno paribhuñji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.3.eng: A certain monk ate another monk’s portion, thinking it was his own.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.4.eng: When the other monk found out about this, he accused him, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.8.eng: “I thought it was my own, sir.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.9.eng: “There’s no offense for one who perceives it as his own.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.10.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū cīvarakammaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.10.eng: On one occasion a number of monks were making robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.11.pli: Saṅghassa khādanīye bhājīyamāne aññatarassa bhikkhuno pattena aññatarassa bhikkhuno paṭiviso āharitvā upanikkhitto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.11.eng: When fresh food belonging to the Sangha was being distributed, they brought a certain monk’s share in another monk’s almsbowl and put it aside.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.12.eng: The monk who was the owner of the bowl ate the food, thinking it was his own.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.13.eng: When he found out about this, the owner of the food accused him

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.20.16.eng: “There’s no offense for one who perceives it as his own.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ambacorakā ambaṃ pātetvā bhaṇḍikaṃ ādāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.1.eng: On one occasion mango thieves cut down some mangoes, collected them in a bundle, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.3.pli: Corakā sāmike passitvā bhaṇḍikaṃ pātetvā palāyiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.3.eng: When they saw the owners, the thieves dropped the bundle and ran away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.4.eng: Some monks perceived those mangoes as discarded, had them offered, and ate them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.5.eng: But the owners accused them, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.11.eng: “There’s no offense for one who perceives something as discarded.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.12.comm: “Rose apple” renders jambu. The jambu is normally identified with the rose apple (tree), but according to PED it is the Eugenia jambolana (tree), which is actually the black-plum tree. I have not been able to ascertain which of these interpretations is correct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.17.pli: timbarūsakacorakā timbarūsake uccinitvā bhaṇḍikaṃ ādāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.17.eng: gaub fruit thieves picked some fruit, collected them in a bundle, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.19.pli: Corakā sāmike passitvā bhaṇḍikaṃ pātetvā palāyiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.19.eng: When they saw the owners, the thieves dropped the bundle and ran away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.20.eng: Some monks perceived those gaub fruit as discarded, had them offered, and ate them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.21.eng: But the owners accused them, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.21.24.eng: “There’s no offense for one who perceives something as discarded.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ambacorakā ambaṃ pātetvā bhaṇḍikaṃ ādāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.1.eng: On one occasion mango thieves cut down some mangoes, collected them in a bundle, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.3.pli: Corakā sāmike passitvā bhaṇḍikaṃ pātetvā palāyiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.3.eng: When they saw the owners, the thieves dropped the bundle and ran away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.4.eng: Some monks ate them, intending to steal them before the owners found them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.5.eng: The owners accused those monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.8.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.14.pli: timbarūsakacorakā timbarūsake uccinitvā bhaṇḍikaṃ ādāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.14.eng: gaub fruit thieves picked some fruit, collected them in a bundle, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.16.pli: Corakā sāmike passitvā bhaṇḍikaṃ pātetvā palāyiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.16.eng: When they saw the owners, the thieves dropped the bundle and ran away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.17.eng: Some monks ate them, intending to steal them before the owners found them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.18.eng: The owners accused those monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.22.21.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.23.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa ambaṃ theyyacitto avahari …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.23.1.eng: On one occasion a monk took a mango from the Sangha, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.23.7.eng: a gaub fruit from the Sangha, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.23.9.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.24.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu pupphārāmaṃ gantvā ocitaṃ pupphaṃ pañcamāsagghanakaṃ theyyacitto avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.24.1.eng: On one occasion a monk went to a garden and took a cut flower worth five māsaka coins, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.24.3.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.24.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu pupphārāmaṃ gantvā pupphaṃ ocinitvā pañcamāsagghanakaṃ theyyacitto avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.24.4.eng: On one occasion a monk went to a garden, picked a flower worth five māsaka coins, and took it away, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.24.6.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gāmakaṃ gacchanto aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.1.eng: On one occasion a certain monk who was going to the village said to another monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.2.eng: “I can take a message to the family that supports you.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.2.comm: The unusual expression vutto vajjemi recurs in the next two cases. Vajjemi is apparently an optative formation from vadāmi, “I could say”, whereas vutto is the past participle of vuccati, “spoken to”, the overall meaning being, “I, (having been) spoken to, could say to the family that supports you.” The idea conveyed seems to be the taking of a message. Sp 1.150: Tava vacanena vadāmīti attho, “The meaning is, ‘I will speak your statement.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.3.pli: So gantvā ekaṃ sāṭakaṃ āharāpetvā attanā paribhuñji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.3.eng: He went there and brought back a wrap garment that he used himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.4.eng: When the other monk found out about this, he accused him, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.8.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, vutto vajjemīti vattabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.8.eng: But you shouldn’t say, ‘I can take a message.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.10.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gāmakaṃ gacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.10.eng: On one occasion a certain monk was going to the village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.12.eng: “Please take a message to the family that supports me.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.13.pli: So gantvā yugasāṭakaṃ āharāpetvā ekaṃ attanā paribhuñji, ekaṃ tassa bhikkhuno adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.13.eng: He went there and brought back a pair of wrap garments. He used one himself and gave the other to the other monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.14.eng: When the other monk found out about this, he accused him, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.18.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, vutto vajjehīti vattabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.18.eng: But you shouldn’t say, ‘Please take a message.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.19.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.20.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gāmakaṃ gacchanto aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.20.eng: On one occasion a monk who was going to the village said to another monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.21.eng: “I can take a message to the family that supports you.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.24.pli: So gantvā āḷhakaṃ sappiṃ tulaṃ guḷaṃ doṇaṃ taṇḍulaṃ āharāpetvā attanā paribhuñji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.24.eng: He went there and brought back an āḷhaka measure of ghee, a tulā measure of sugar, and a doṇa measure of husked rice, which he ate himself.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.24.comm: According to T. W. Rhys Davids in “On the Ancient Coins and Measures of Ceylon: with a discussion of the Ceylon date of the Buddha’s death”, p. 18, one doṇa is equivalent to 64 handfuls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.25.eng: When the other monk found out about this, he accused him, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.29.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, vutto vajjemīti vattabbo, na ca vutto vajjehīti vattabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.29.eng: But you shouldn’t say, ‘I can take a message;’ nor should you say, ‘Please do.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.25.30.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso mahagghaṃ maṇiṃ ādāya aññatarena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.1.eng: At one time a man who was traveling with a monk was carrying a valuable gem.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.2.pli: Atha kho so puriso suṅkaṭṭhānaṃ passitvā tassa bhikkhuno ajānantassa thavikāya maṇiṃ pakkhipitvā suṅkaṭṭhānaṃ atikkamitvā aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.2.eng: When the man saw a customs station, he put the gem into the monk’s bag without his knowing. When they had gone past the customs station, he retrieved it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.6.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t know.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso mahagghaṃ maṇiṃ ādāya aññatarena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.7.eng: At one time a man who was traveling with a monk was carrying a valuable gem.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.8.pli: Atha kho so puriso suṅkaṭṭhānaṃ passitvā gilānālayaṃ karitvā attano bhaṇḍikaṃ tassa bhikkhuno adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.8.eng: When the man saw a customs station, he pretended to be sick, and gave his own bag to the monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.9.pli: Atha kho so puriso suṅkaṭṭhānaṃ atikkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.9.eng: When they had passed the customs station, he said to the monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.10.eng: “Please give me my bag, sir, I’m not sick.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.12.pli: Atha kho so puriso tassa bhikkhuno etamatthaṃ ārocesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.16.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t know.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.17.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu satthena saddhiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.17.eng: At one time a monk was traveling with a group.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.18.pli: Aññataro puriso taṃ bhikkhuṃ āmisena upalāpetvā suṅkaṭṭhānaṃ passitvā mahagghaṃ maṇiṃ tassa bhikkhuno adāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.18.eng: A man bribed that monk by giving him food. Seeing a customs station, he gave the monk a valuable gem, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.19.eng: “Sir, please take this gem past the customs,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.20.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu taṃ maṇiṃ suṅkaṭṭhānaṃ atikkāmesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.26.22.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu pāse bandhaṃ sūkaraṃ kāruññena muñci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.1.eng: On one occasion a monk, feeling compassion, released a pig trapped in a snare.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.5.eng: “There’s no offense for one who is motivated by compassion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu pāse bandhaṃ sūkaraṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.6.eng: On one occasion a monk released a pig trapped in a snare,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.7.eng: intending to steal it before the owners found it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.9.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.10.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu pāse bandhaṃ migaṃ kāruññena muñci …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.10.eng: On one occasion a monk, feeling compassion, released a deer trapped in a snare. … “There’s no offense for one who is motivated by compassion.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.11.eng: released a deer trapped in a snare,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.12.eng: intending to steal it before the owners found it. … “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.13.eng: feeling compassion, released fish trapped in a fish-net … “There’s no offense for one who is motivated by compassion.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.14.eng: released fish trapped in a fish-net,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.15.eng: intending to steal them before the owners found them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.27.17.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.28.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu yāne bhaṇḍaṃ passitvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.28.1.eng: On one occasion a monk saw some goods in a vehicle.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.28.2.eng: He thought, “If I take them from there, I’ll be expelled.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.28.3.eng: So he took them by setting the vehicle in motion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.28.5.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.29.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kulalena ukkhittaṃ maṃsapesiṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.29.1.eng: On one occasion a monk seized a piece of meat picked up by a hawk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.29.2.eng: intending to give it to the owners.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.29.3.eng: But the owners accused him, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.29.6.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t intend to steal.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.29.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kulalena ukkhittaṃ maṃsapesiṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.29.7.eng: On one occasion a monk seized a piece of meat picked up by a hawk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.29.8.eng: intending to steal it before the owners found out.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.29.12.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā uḷumpaṃ bandhitvā aciravatiyā nadiyā osārenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.1.eng: At one time some men made a raft that they put on the river Aciravatī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.2.eng: Because the binding ropes snapped, the sticks were scattered about.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.3.eng: Some monks removed them from the water, perceiving them as discarded.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.4.eng: The owners accused those monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.7.eng: “There’s no offense for one who perceives something as discarded.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā uḷumpaṃ bandhitvā aciravatiyā nadiyā osārenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.8.eng: At one time some men made a raft, which they put on the river Aciravatī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.9.eng: Because the binding ropes snapped, the sticks were scattered about.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.10.eng: Some monks removed them from the water, intending to steal them before the owners found them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.11.eng: The owners accused those monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.30.14.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.31.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro gopālako rukkhe sāṭakaṃ ālaggetvā uccāraṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.31.1.eng: On one occasion a cowherd hung his wrap garment on a tree and went to relieve himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.31.2.eng: A monk thought it had been discarded and took it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.31.3.pli: Atha kho so gopālako taṃ bhikkhuṃ codesi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.31.6.eng: “There’s no offense for one who perceives something as discarded.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno nadiṃ tarantassa rajakānaṃ hatthato muttaṃ sāṭakaṃ pāde laggaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.1.eng: On one occasion, a wrap garment that had escaped from the hands of a dyer stuck to a monk’s foot as he was crossing a river.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.2.eng: The monk took hold of it, thinking, “I’ll give it to its owners.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.3.eng: But the owners accused him, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.6.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t intend to steal.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno nadiṃ tarantassa rajakānaṃ hatthato muttaṃ sāṭakaṃ pāde laggaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.7.eng: On one occasion, a wrap garment that had escaped from the hands of a dyer stuck to a monk’s foot as he was crossing a river.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.8.pli: So bhikkhu—“pure sāmikā passantī”ti, theyyacitto aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.8.eng: The monk took hold of it, intending to steal it before the owners found it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.32.12.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.33.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sappikumbhiṃ passitvā thokaṃ thokaṃ paribhuñji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.33.1.eng: On one occasion a monk saw a pot of ghee and ate it little by little.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.33.4.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū saṃvidahitvā agamaṃsu—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.1.eng: At one time a number of monks made an arrangement and then left, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.3.eng: One of them stole the goods.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.6.eng: He who stole them is expelled.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.8.eng: “You’ve all committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū saṃvidahitvā bhaṇḍaṃ avaharitvā bhājesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.9.eng: At one time a number of monks made an arrangement, stole some goods, and shared them out.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.10.pli: Tehi bhājīyamāne ekamekassa paṭiviso na pañcamāsako pūri.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.10.eng: Each one of them received a share worth less than five māsaka coins.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.34.14.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.35.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sāvatthiyaṃ dubbhikkhe āpaṇikassa taṇḍulamuṭṭhiṃ theyyacitto avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.35.1.eng: On one occasion when Sāvatthī was short of food, a monk took a handful of rice from a shopkeeper, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.35.3.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.35.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sāvatthiyaṃ dubbhikkhe āpaṇikassa muggamuṭṭhiṃ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.35.4.eng: On one occasion when Sāvatthī was short of food, a monk stole a handful of mung beans from a shopkeeper, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.35.6.eng: a handful of sesame from a shopkeeper, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.35.8.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ andhavane corakā gāviṃ hantvā maṃsaṃ khāditvā sesakaṃ paṭisāmetvā agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.1.eng: At one time in the Dark Wood near Sāvatthī, thieves killed a cow, ate some of the flesh, put the remainder aside, and went away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.2.eng: Some monks had it offered and ate it, perceiving it as discarded.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.3.eng: The thieves accused those monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.6.eng: “There’s no offense for one who perceives something as discarded.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ andhavane corakā sūkaraṃ hantvā maṃsaṃ khāditvā sesakaṃ paṭisāmetvā agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.7.eng: At one time in the Dark Wood near Sāvatthī, thieves killed a pig, ate some of the flesh, put the remainder aside, and went away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.8.eng: Some monks had it offered and ate it, perceiving it as discarded.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.9.eng: The thieves accused those monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.36.12.eng: “There’s no offense for one who perceives something as discarded.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.37.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu tiṇakkhettaṃ gantvā lūtaṃ tiṇaṃ pañcamāsagghanakaṃ theyyacitto avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.37.1.eng: On one occasion a monk went to a meadow and took cut grass worth five māsaka coins, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.37.3.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.37.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu tiṇakkhettaṃ gantvā tiṇaṃ lāyitvā pañcamāsagghanakaṃ theyyacitto avahari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.37.4.eng: On one occasion a monk went to a meadow, cut grass worth five māsaka coins, and took it away, intending to steal it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.37.6.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āgantukā bhikkhū saṅghassa ambaṃ bhājāpetvā paribhuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.1.eng: On one occasion some newly-arrived monks shared out the mangoes belonging to the Sangha and ate them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.2.eng: The resident monks accused those monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.7.eng: “We thought they were meant for eating, sir.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.8.eng: “There’s no offense for one who thinks it is meant for eating.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āgantukā bhikkhū saṅghassa jambuṃ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.9.eng: On one occasion some newly-arrived monks shared out the rose apples belonging to the Sangha …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.10.eng: the bread-fruit belonging to the Sangha …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.11.eng: the jack-fruit belonging to the Sangha …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.12.eng: the palm fruits belonging to the Sangha …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.13.eng: the sugarcane belonging to the Sangha …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.14.eng: the gaub fruit belonging to the Sangha and ate them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.15.eng: The resident monks accused those monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.38.18.eng: “There’s no offense for one who thinks it is meant for eating.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ambapālakā bhikkhūnaṃ ambaphalaṃ denti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.1.eng: On one occasion the keepers of a mango grove gave a mango to some monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.2.eng: The monks, thinking, “They have the authority to guard, but not to give away,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.3.eng: were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.5.eng: “There’s no offense if it’s a gift from a guardian.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.6.eng: On one occasion the keepers of a rose-apple grove …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.7.eng: the keepers of a bread-fruit grove …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.8.eng: the keepers of a jack-fruit grove …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.9.eng: the keepers of a palm grove …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.10.eng: the keepers of a sugarcane field …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.11.eng: the keepers of a gaub fruit grove gave a gaub fruit to some monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.12.eng: The monks, thinking, “They have the authority to guard, but not to give away,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.13.eng: were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.39.15.eng: “There’s no offense if it’s a gift from a guardian.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.40.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa dāruṃ tāvakālikaṃ haritvā attano vihārassa kuṭṭaṃ upatthambhesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.40.1.eng: On one occasion a monk borrowed a piece of wood belonging to the Sangha and used it to support the wall of his own dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.40.8.eng: “There’s no offense for one who is borrowing.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.41.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa udakaṃ theyyacitto avahari …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.41.1.eng: On one occasion a monk took water from the Sangha, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.41.2.eng: took clay from the Sangha, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.41.3.eng: took a pile of grass from the Sangha, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.41.5.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.41.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa puñjakitaṃ tiṇaṃ theyyacitto jhāpesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.41.6.eng: On one occasion a monk set fire to a pile of grass belonging to the Sangha, intending to steal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.41.9.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.42.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa mañcaṃ theyyacitto avahari …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.42.1.eng: On one occasion a monk took a bed from the Sangha, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.42.3.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.42.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu saṅghassa pīṭhaṃ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.42.4.eng: On one occasion a monk took a bench from the Sangha, intending to steal it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.42.9.eng: took a rafter from the Sangha, intending to steal it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.42.11.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.43.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū aññatarassa upāsakassa vihāraparibhogaṃ senāsanaṃ aññatra paribhuñjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.43.1.eng: At one time the monks used elsewhere the equipment belonging to a certain lay follower.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.43.2.pli: Atha kho so upāsako ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.43.2.eng: That lay follower complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.43.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā aññatra paribhogaṃ aññatra paribhuñjissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.43.3.eng: “How can the venerables use equipment where it doesn’t belong?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.43.5.eng: “You shouldn’t use equipment where it doesn’t belong.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.43.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.44.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū uposathaggampi sannisajjampi harituṃ kukkuccāyantā chamāyaṃ nisīdanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.44.1.eng: Soon afterwards, being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not take any furniture to the observance-day hall or to meetings, and they sat down on the bare ground.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.44.2.eng: They became dirty, as did their robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena campāyaṃ thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā antevāsinī bhikkhunī thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā upaṭṭhākakulaṃ gantvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.1.eng: On one occasion at Campā, a nun who was a pupil of the nun Thullanandā went to a family that supported Thullanandā and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.2.eng: “The venerable wants to drink the triple pungent congee.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.3.eng: When it was ready, she took it away and ate it herself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.4.eng: When Thullanandā found out about this, she accused her, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.7.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.8.eng: who in turn told the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.11.eng: but there’s an offense entailing confession for lying in full awareness.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.12.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā antevāsinī bhikkhunī thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā upaṭṭhākakulaṃ gantvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.12.eng: On one occasion in Rājagaha, a nun who was a pupil of the nun Thullanandā went to a family that supported Thullanandā and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.14.eng: When it was ready, she took it away and ate it herself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.15.eng: When Thullanandā found out about this, she accused her, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.45.19.eng: but there’s an offense entailing confession for lying in full awareness.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesāliyaṃ āyasmato ajjukassa upaṭṭhākassa gahapatino dve dārakā honti— putto ca bhāgineyyo ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.1.eng: At that time there was a householder in Vesāli who was a supporter of Venerable Ajjuka and who had two children living with him, a son and a nephew.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.2.pli: Atha kho so gahapati āyasmantaṃ ajjukaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.2.comm: Sp 1.158: Etadavocāti gilāno hutvā avoca, “‘He said’: he said it because of illness.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.3.pli: “imaṃ, bhante, okāsaṃ yo imesaṃ dvinnaṃ dārakānaṃ saddho hoti pasanno tassa ācikkheyyāsī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.3.eng: “Sir, please assign my property to the one of these two boys who has faith and confidence.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tassa gahapatino bhāgineyyo saddho hoti pasanno. Atha kho āyasmā ajjuko taṃ okāsaṃ tassa dārakassa ācikkhi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.4.eng: It turned out that the householder’s nephew had faith and confidence, and so Ajjuka assigned the property to him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.5.pli: So tena sāpateyyena kuṭumbañca saṇṭhapesi dānañca paṭṭhapesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.5.eng: He then established a household with that wealth and made a gift.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.6.pli: Atha kho tassa gahapatino putto āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.6.eng: The householder’s son then said to Venerable Ānanda,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.7.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante ānanda, pituno dāyajjo— putto vā bhāgineyyo vā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.7.eng: “Who is the father’s heir, Venerable Ānanda, the son or the nephew?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.9.pli: “Ayaṃ, bhante, ayyo ajjuko amhākaṃ sāpateyyaṃ amhākaṃ methunakassa ācikkhī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.9.eng: “Sir, Venerable Ajjuka has assigned our wealth to our housemate.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.10.eng: “Venerable Ajjuka is not a monastic anymore.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.11.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ajjuko āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.13.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upāli āyasmato ajjukassa pakkho hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.13.eng: On that occasion Venerable Upāli was siding with Ajjuka,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.14.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upāli āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.15.pli: “yo nu kho, āvuso ānanda, sāmikena ‘imaṃ okāsaṃ itthannāmassa ācikkheyyāsī’ti vutto tassa ācikkhati, kiṃ so āpajjatī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.15.eng: “Ānanda, when one is asked by the owner to assign a property to so-and-so and one does as asked, what has one committed?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.16.eng: “One hasn’t committed anything, sir, not even an act of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.17.pli: “Ayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmā ajjuko sāmikena—‘imaṃ okāsaṃ itthannāmassa ācikkhā’ti vutto tassa ācikkhati;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.17.eng: “Venerable Ajjuka was asked by the owner to assign his property to so-and-so, which he did.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.46.18.eng: There’s no offense for Venerable Ajjuka.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bārāṇasiyaṃ āyasmato pilindavacchassa upaṭṭhākakulaṃ corehi upaddutaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.1.eng: At that time a family in Benares that supported Venerable Pilindavaccha was harassed by criminals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.2.eng: Two of their children were kidnapped.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.3.pli: Atha kho āyasmā pilindavaccho te dārake iddhiyā ānetvā pāsāde ṭhapesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.3.eng: Soon afterwards Pilindavaccha brought those children back by his supernormal powers and put them in a stilt house.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.3.comm: “Stilt house” renders pāsāda. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.4.eng: When people saw those children, they said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.5.eng: “This is the greatness of Venerable Pilindavaccha’s supernormal powers,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.6.eng: and they gained confidence in him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.7.eng: But the monks complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā pilindavaccho corehi nīte dārake ānessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.8.eng: “How could Venerable Pilindavaccha bring back children who had been kidnapped by criminals?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.47.10.eng: “There’s no offense for someone who uses their supernormal powers.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sahāyakā honti—paṇḍuko ca kapilo ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.1.eng: At that time the two monks Paṇḍaka and Kapila were friends.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.2.eng: One was staying in a village and one at Kosambī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.3.pli: Atha kho tassa bhikkhuno gāmakā kosambiṃ gacchantassa antarāmagge nadiṃ tarantassa sūkarikānaṃ hatthato muttā medavaṭṭi pāde laggā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.3.eng: Then, while one of them was traveling from that village to Kosambī, he had to cross a river. As he did so, a lump of fat that had escaped from the hands of a pig butcher stuck to his foot.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.4.eng: He grabbed it, thinking, “I’ll give it to the owners.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.5.eng: But the owners accused him, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.7.eng: Just then a woman cowherd who had seen him crossing said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.9.pli: So—“pakatiyāpāhaṃ assamaṇo”ti tassā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.9.eng: Thinking he was no longer a monastic, he had sexual intercourse with her.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.10.eng: When he arrived at Kosambī, he told the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.11.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.12.eng: “There’s no offense entailing expulsion for stealing,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.48.13.eng: but there’s an offense entailing expulsion for having sexual intercourse.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.49.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāgalāyaṃ āyasmato daḷhikassa saddhivihāriko bhikkhu anabhiratiyā pīḷito āpaṇikassa veṭhanaṃ avaharitvā āyasmantaṃ daḷhikaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.49.1.eng: At that time a monk at Sāgalā who was a student of Venerable Daḷhika was plagued by lust. He stole a turban from a shopkeeper and said to Daḷhika,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.49.2.eng: “Sir, I’m not a monastic anymore. I’ll disrobe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.49.5.eng: Venerable Daḷhika had the turban brought and valued.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.49.6.eng: It was worth less than five māsaka coins.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj2:7.49.10.eng: The second offense entailing expulsion is finished.
